questionContent.text: What are the minimum and maximum values of the expression, respectively? \[ \cos \theta\left(\sin \theta+\sqrt{\sin ^2 \theta+3}\right) \]
Suppose \(f(x)\) and \(g(x)\) are real-valued differentiable functions such that \(f^{\prime}(x) \geq g^{\prime}(x)\) for all \(x\) in \([0,1]\). Which of the following is necessarily true?

option.text: \( f+g\) is a non-decreasing function on \([0,1]\)

question.solution: The condition \(f^{\prime}(x)-g^{\prime}(x) \geq 0\) implies that \(f(x)-g(x)\) is an increasing function on \([0,1]\). Therefore \(f(1)-g(1) \geq f(0)-g(0)\). MMC 14

questionContent.text: Let \(\mathbb{R}^{+}\)be the set of positive real numbers. Suppose \(f: \mathbb{R}^{+} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^{+}\) such that, for all \(x, y \in \mathbb{R}^{+}\), \[ f(x y+f(x))=x f(y)+2 \]
How many functions satisfy the above condition?
How many pairs \( (x, y) \) of integers exist such that \( y^2=x(x+1)(x+2) \).

question.solution: If \(x< -2\), then there is no solution. If \(x=0,-1,-2\), then \(y=0\). If \(x \geq 1\), then \(\operatorname{gcd}(x+1, x(x+2))=1\). Therefore \((x+1)\) and \(x(x+2)\) are both perfect squares. But, \(x(x+2)=x^2+2 x=(x+1)^2-1\). This implies \((x+1)^2\) and \((x+1)^2-1\) are consecutive numbers which are squares. This is not possible. MMC 2014.

questionContent.text: A 40 feet high pole is put on a vertical wall 10 feet above your eye-level. How far should you stand approximately to maximize the angle subtended by the pole ,from top to bottom, at your eye?
Consider a sequence given by \(a_n=a_{n-1}+3 a_{n-2}+a_{n-3}\), where \(a_0=a_1=a_2=1\). What is the remainder of \(a_{2013}\) divided by 7?
The vertices of a regular pentagon are concyclic. If the length of each side of the pentagon is 1, the radius of the circumcircle is
If \(p\) is a prime number and \(a>1\) is a natural number, then the greatest common divisor of the two numbers \(a-1\) and \(\frac{a^p-1}{a-1}\) can be:
How many trailing zeros does the value \[ 300 \cdot 305 \cdot 310 \cdots 1090 \cdot 1095 \cdot 1100 \] end with?

Triangle \(A B C\) has side lengths \(A B=39, B C=16\), and \(C A=25\). What is the approximate volume of the solid formed by rotating the triangle \(ABC\) about line \(B C\)? Write an integer value that is within \(\pm\) 3 units of the actual volume.

Equilateral triangle \(\triangle A B C\) is inscribed in circle \(\Omega\), which has a radius of 1. Let the midpoint of \(B C\) be \(M\). Line \(A M\) intersects \(\Omega\) again at point \(D\). Let \(\omega\) be the circle with diameter \(M D\). Compute the radius of the circle that is tangent to \(B C\) on the same side of \(B C\) as \(\omega\), internally tangent to \(\Omega\), and externally tangent to \(\omega\).
Find the number of ways in which three numbers can be selected from the set \(\{1,2, \cdots, 12\}\), such that the sum of the three selected numbers is divisible by 4.
Suppose \(f: \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}\) is a non-constant function satisfying \(f(x+y)=f(x) f(y)\) for all \(x, y \in \mathbb{R}\). Show that
((a)) \(f(x) \neq 0\) for all \(x \in \mathbb{R}\)
((b)) \(f(x)>0\) for all \(x \in \mathbb{R}\)
For how many real numbers \(x\) do we have that \(\log_5(1+x)=x\) ?
Let \(r_1(t) \leq r_2(t) \leq r_3(t)\) be the roots of \(x^3+t x+2\). When \(t=-3\), compute \(r_1^{\prime}(t)\).
A \(3 \times 3\) grid is to be painted with three colors red, green, and blue such that
1. no two squares that share an edge are the same color and
2. no two corner squares on the same edge of the grid have the same color.

As an example, the upper-left and bottom-left squares cannot both be red, as that would violate condition the second condition. In how many ways can this be done? Rotations and reflections are considered distinct colorings.
